metadata.title: CVE-2024-25744 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel before 6.6.7, an untrusted VMM can trigger int80syscall handling at any given point. This is related toarch/x86/coco/tdx/tdx.c and arch/x86/mm/mem_encrypt_amd.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-25744` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.8.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.8.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.8.0-7.7
No subscription required

linux-image-6.7.0-1001-raspi - 6.7.0-1001.1
No subscription required
